question:
With reference to the first ever Indian presidential visit to Slovenia, consider the following statements about the European country:
  1. It has a shore along the Tyrrhenian Sea.
  2. It is a member of EU and NATO.
Which of the above statements is/are true?
explanation: Statement 1 is incorrect: Slovenia has its south-western shore along the Adriatic Sea. It is bordered by Italy in the west, Austria in the north, Hungary to the northeast and Croatia to southwest. It is a central European country. Its terrain is mostly mountainous. Â Statement 2 is correct: Slovenia is a member of the NATO and EU. It is a high-income advanced economy that is very export oriented. It entered into NATO in 2004 and into the EU in 2007. It is also a member of the OECD.
